Space Dandy is one of the most fun animes that I’ve seen in years, but more importantly it never takes itself seriously, which makes for a very entertaining experience each time. For those who have never seen this show it’s about a bounty hunter in space who searches for new alien life for registration, but Dandy almost always fails at this. Furthermore, that’s one of the aspects I like most about this series. 
Read my entire review on my blog at http://popcultreviews.com/2014/12/02/space-dandy-amazon-exclusive-alohaoe-edition-2/
I go into much more detail there, plus I have many other anime, and video game articles and reviews you might like.

You know its going to be a fanboy review when the person has a profile picture as one of the characters in the show.
Ok, lets get this put the way, if your a fan of getting involved with story and plots, behold, there is not much of it. I have watched both seasons, and you need to know right now: the first three episodes have a plot to the show, but take another route after those episodes. I got confused the first time, but I settled with it. But just because there isnt much of a plot, the anime still carries fairly well throughout thewhole season, it has some really good moments. Comedy isnt its only profession, it has other sub plots too, like romance and slice of life. If you like romance, find the episode where QT falls in love with a coffee machine, its actaully pretty sweet.


And if you need help with the plot, let me enlighten you: Dandy is a space hunter who travels throughout space with his robot companion, QT in search to find creatures, and get them registered to earn money. They encounter a ancestor of a cat called Meow, who is basically the whole weaboo demographic. (haha.) He believes that he can find rare species to get registered, and so they have him aboard. I said before how after 3 episodes it loses its plot, but it actaully start off with the plot with every new episode, but just takes another turn.


If you havent watched this anime before, only watched about a couple of episodes, I pledge you to keep watching, because it really is a lost gem. DONT WATCH THE DUBBED VERSION, IT CHANGES CERTAIN ASPECTS.

Don't go into this show expecting a Cowboy Bebop tier story and world.
That being said Space Dandy is a show with a lot of heart and creativity that has taken me by surprise and given me an incredibly enjoyable experience. From the beautiful animation, interesting character designs, and varying genre soundtrack I was quickly sucked into the fun time that is Space Dandy.
Don't get hung up on the main story, it's complete garbage and only plays a part in giving a "Team Rocket" sense of humor which can definitely fall flat. But it makes up for it by doing an incredible job drawing you intoa new world with each episode, introducing well drawn worlds with their own interesting conflicts and resolutions. At each episode I found myself craving more of these newly introduced characters, mostly giving them fitting ends but enjoying the short time I had with them only for them to be replaced by another well written or just plain lovably quirky character. \n\n
All in all Space Dandy is an enjoyable series that shouldn't be taken too seriously. Go into Space Dandy with a sense of wonder and fun, and let it take you on its colorful journey aboard the Aloha Oe.

Do note that this review reflects my thoughts on both "seasons" to Space Dandy as a whole. This said, on with the review:
Space Dandy is the fourth TV anime directed by the highly acclaimed Shinichiro Watanabe which is a sci-fi comedy focused on an alien hunter named Dandy who finds himself in some sort of comical shenanigans during his hunts in each episode. 
The series is mostly a parody of sci-fi space opera tropes with the series occasionally breaking the fourth wall, Dandy often getting in some sort of dimensional hopping shenanigans, usually being killed in some episodes and being fine in the next one,members of an enemy empire incompetently seeking him out and failing to even reach him, and never stopping with his continued obsession with visiting the Hooters-like Boobies "breastaurant". At first glance, the series may seem completely episodic and self-contained with many of its plots considering Dandy is well and good the following episode if he or all of the universe get killed in some fashion throughout the series. But later episodes do drop hints that things are not as they would seem on the surface with our "dandy guy in space" and all. 


The comedy throughout the series is hit-or-miss for me as the clueless characters of Dandy, Meow, and QT did get stale for me as episodes progressed, though some of the supporting characters such as the surprisingly insightful Honey and the no-nonsense Scarlet caught my interest with their behavior and actions. In addition, some episodes are focused on providing some more fleshing out of the characters which while appreciated, often did not do much for me to get to care for them due to mostly being focused on in a single episode.


The highlight of the series comes from its very impressive animation as Space Dandy sports smoothly detailed and vividly-colored designs, while offering diverse variety in the number of human and alien designs seen throughout the series. Movements are very fluid with a variety of action sequences and some unique animation styles being milked at points thanks to Dandy's interdimensional travels, with CGI renderings of spaceships and the effects of Dandy crossing into dimensions milking CG animation that blends seamlessly with the regular animation for the most part.


Overall, I felt Space Dandy's hype mostly came from Watanabe's fame and its space comedy premise being accessible to Western audiences. While Dandy's antics and the seemingly episodic developments within the show do come with a surprising reason that makes sense when revealed in its climax and was a clever twist for the series, the comedy for it did gradually lose its luster for me with time and the characters were mostly too limited with their traits and personalities for me to want to rewatch it too often. While I am a fan of Watanabe's previous works like Cowboy Bebop and Kids on the Slope, Space Dandy appears to be the weakest of the TV anime titles I've seen directed by him.

Space Dandy is a dandy in space-- I'm not sure if that meant he's just some cool guy. But let's go on with our review.
Space Dandy has different themes in each episode, but it's mostly and usually in space, with the same main characters. 
Story
As I said, it's all random. Not a continuous story that continue each episode. It's one story each episode, but with the same main characters doing random stuff. It's got a simple story, where they hunt for aliens like what the summary says. The story's not super unique but it's pretty funny and nice to just see what the characters areup to. I'm pretty sure all the episodes are fillers since it's all got random stories that doesn't really-- I think I made my point.

Last episode was the same as the others, another episode that focus on one of the main characters. 


Overall, I guess the story is nice. I'd give it an 8. Enjoyable enough to watch if you're bored and just wanna see random antics. 


Art


Art style is nice. Not super realistic, or deformed like Pop Team Epic. I guess it's more like the normal anime I've seen. Cowboy bebop with sorta Code Geass in some episodes.

Standard style. It fits the story just fine. The space background's pretty good. I like space. Easy to tell each other apart cause they have different designs.


I'd give it a 10.


Sound


The characters fit their voice just fine. Ending and Opening song is alright too. I didn't really pay much attention to the theme songs cause I  wanted to skip right to the part of the story. I didn't think there was anything wrong with the music so I guess it's a 10.


Character


The BBP (Blockhead, Bonehead, and Pinhead) a.k.a Dandy, Meow, and QT are alright. I don't think there was much changes or development to their personalities. They're usually just slow or dumb or doing something pointless haha. It's funny since I guess that's what I do too in my everyday life. Pointless stuff. 


Gogol Empire is weird since they seem to want Dandy but it's not explained why in this season. Something that would make them more powerful, I assume. The villain gorilla man keeps dying hahaha but comes back again next episode. 


The narrator sometimes talks with the characters and it has the 4th wall being broken but that's rare.


I didn't dislike anyone in the show. They're all fine the way they are.


I'm not sure if I'd remember the characters much. Maybe just the main characters and their faces.


Enjoyment


I guess people who like space and have nothing else to do with their free time can enjoy this like I do.

I guess Americans would like it since it's already shown in AdultSwim/Toonami.

Don't know if I'd rewatch anytime soon but maybe one day in the far future.

It's enjoyable enough to remember from time to time.


Rating it an 8 (changed to 9)


I'll rate it an 8 overall. It's pretty good enough and I've rated worst stuff at like, 7 or something. I should probably change it to a 9 since that seems like a better idea.

Shinichiro Watanabe, the director of the Cowboy Bebop and Samurai Champloo anime is the Chief Director for Space Dandy so I thought I was in for a treat.  I really tried to like Space Dandy but couldn't. The light over-hanging plot is that an alien hunter named Dandy, whose job is to discover new alien life forms across the galaxy and have them registered with the Space Alien Registration Center; the almost Cowboy Bebop vibe wasn't compelling enough to save the show. The characters have potential to be great but aren't. The only character that was almost likable was the cat alien Meow. Themain character Dandy, is a disappointing version of Spike Spiegel and Mugen. At least the animation was great because its by Bones Inc, the company who helped animate the Soul Eater anime and some of the FMA anime. If you are looking for another Cowboy Bebop or Samurai Champloo, look elsewhere.

A masterpiece, there is no other way for me to describe "Space Dandy" a genre of itself.
 During the first few minutes of watching the first initial episode I was hesitant to whether I could genuinely enjoy or understand the plot, but little did I acknowledge this anime is not meant to be taken literally it is to make you laugh, cry, and think but most importantly appreciate what anime can still offer us. I hope you too can enjoy Space Dandy as much as I do, baby.

Space Dandy is... dandy. It's another "male gaze" anime, with a few female gaze moments. It's an open-ended type of title but I would say that works to it's advantage. It's a very fun series, with a wide range of mix of things going on! Some of the humor is too face-value perverted for me. I more enjoy the serious times. I suggest this series for anyone with a wide platte.
The art, sound, and writing are high quality. Nothing about the soundtrack stood out, but the music is emotionally and scenically influenced. The mean characters lack depth, but it fits the format of the show.The side characters take a lot of the light. The parts I disliked I found boring or useless. The parts that I did like were mid joy at worst but nothing made me explosively happy. There are some funny bits, even for me. There were a few times in the serious ones where I was moved to tears, I'll admit it.\n\n
Sub or dub? Both!

Lets take a trip into space baby...
Story:
Let me say this first, Space Dandy doesn't revolve around a plot. The Show takes place in kinda different events that don't correspond with the last episode, so if per say all the characters died last episode everything would reset and a new adventure would take place. This concept is what brought this show down for me. Ya its funny, really funny, but whats the point of what is happening on the screen? Overall the story was fun, but didn't revolve like a story should, more like cartoon if you want to of it like that. (6)
Art:
It was groovy.I don't have much to say about the art. Everything was animated smoothly and blended together great. The main characters were done well and really showcased their personalities. (10)


Sound:

One of the best parts about this show was how well the U.S voice actors played their parts. When i hear the actors speak their lines and portray their parts it makes me think this anime was meant to be spoken in English. An example would be  the narrator: The narrator Added a lot of character to the story with his deep, philosophical sounding voice that had something in it that made the show sound even funnier, though he isn't any Morgan Freeman but comes close. But in the end it sounded really good in every aspect. (9)


Character:

This show revolves around the wacky space crew of Dandy, Meow, and QT, who get chased around by Dr. Gel and his wacky assistant Bee. Each of these characters and all the others that pop in each episode are so well designed and have so much character in them. I found one of the best parts of writing this review was thinking about all the characters i met in Dandy's adventures. trust me when i say this, I loved all the main and supporting characters and you will too. (10)


Enjoyment:

it was a fun ride. There was a lot of fun on the adventure with Dandy in the show. Every episode was funny and felt very well thought about. Nothing in this show seemed rushed or overly cheesy, i say this because some events ARE very very cheese but on purpose to make the viewer laugh which I did. (9)


Overall:

Space Dandy I found was a gem hidden the the toonami block of Adult Swim's Saturdays block. I hadn't heard of this show before i saw it late at night by chance, and what i like was that the show wasn't ruined by over hype that many shows and video games these days come short because of. At the end is a really interesting 13 episode season. With another one to watch. So i give Space dandy a 8 out of 10. It is a hell a lot of fun to watch. Though if you want something really serious like i did, you won't want to watch this. Despite that, this show is really something. 


P.S: If you liked this review, or hated it and want to maker me review better, than comment/message me if you have the time. I will also try to get to season 2 for this show when I can.

Incredibly Versatile and Wacky
It's good, every week brought to you by another director, and a different animation style.
Each week of the first season feels like they're mimicking classic anime episode tropes, and while the second season also has that, a lot of the episodes are more free form.
You follow a few consistent characters who are alien bounty hunters (and a narrator) and the mysteries that arise around them, but mostly its just episodic, wacky, fun and often surprising.
Also SPACE! 
[and the occasional fanservice, so if that bothers you watch out.]

'Space Dandy' is a show that doesn't bother trying to make sense and instead just throws a bunch of stuff together in order to try and keep you entertained.
     This is one of those shows that doesn't care weather or not it makes any sense, and instead just tries to entertain you with its comedy, unique style, and upbeat tone. This show is very inconstant, and makes absolutely no sense. Some episodes may leave with the entire cast dead, with them all mysteriously back in the next episode with no explanation. The tone of each episode seem to be a littledifferent from each other as well. This is probably because multiple directors worked on different episodes of this show. With most shows, not making any sense will ruin the entire series, however, there are some shows out there that don't lose everything from it and sometimes are improved by the ridiculousness of it. These are what I like to call goofy comedies. This basically means films that develop their specific tone and comedy through their bazaar plots and use the fact it makes no sense for comedy. 'Space Dandy' is a series I believe attempted to do this so the inconsistency of the show shouldn't be too much of a big deal. If you are expecting a show with a amazing plot and story-line, look elsewhere. If you just want some quick entertainment, keep reading.


You may think I just said that the fact the story doesn't entirely make sense wasn't that big of a deal since it fit the style of the show. Even though this may be true, there is still one mandatory thing you must have when it comes to shows like that. This is the comedy. In order for a show to gain entertainment off of it's ridiculousness, it has to be funny as well. When it comes to 'space dandy' The comedy involved in the show is very repetitive and to be fully honest, I didn't really find it that funny. Instead it just felt boring. This is probably the biggest flaw of 'Space Dandy.' There may have been a few funny scenes during this show that may be worth watching for, but if you are to watch this show than I should warn you that some episodes are far better than others. 


'Space Dandy' is a series you either love or hate. If you don't enjoy the first few episodes, than you can stop watching because you probably won't enjoy the rest. This show is designed for people who just want some quick entertainment, not those looking for a quality story or anything more. If you are still considering this show, give it a try. If you don't like it, you can give it up without worrying it will change a lot from the start. 


I give 'Space Dandy' a 5/10. (which is a pretty low rating for the way I rate stuff)

Space Dandy was surprisingly good, after watching cowboy bebop my expectations for this show were very high and the show delivered. It had me laughing out loud at times, and feeling sad at others Each episode was different and yet all played out very similarity. The bad guy would chase the three protagonists around each episode without the main characters even knowing. The fan service in the show came in the form of a resteraunt called "boobies" which played a major role in the show, and Dandys love for the resteraunt was hilarious at times. The shows characters are all amazingly three dimensional and youstart to care more for them as the show progresses. And to top it all off, an amazing soundtrack, cowboy bebop follows a jazz theme whereas this follows a Hawaii theme which I thought was great. The art design was beautiful and at times the animation blew me away. Overall I really enjoyed the show and would recommend it to any fan of comedy as a genre.

Well, it's definitely one of the most creative anime I've ever seen. I always found anime with a very peculiar concept interesting, and here, the touch of Watanabe is clear, although music is not as great as Cowboy Bebop, Samurai Champloo or Kids on the Slope, maybe because Yoko Kanno was not fully involved. It's very difficult to write a review, because the show is very weird, and surely completely different from any other show you have ever seen. However, to give a benchmark, if you like Douglas Adams' narrative you will enjoy the show and the kind of comedy depicted.

I'm 12 episodes in and I feel like I should give this a review here. I'm really enjoying it more with each episode. At first when you watch it it seems like its just a cheesy fan service show. Its got a bit of that but it's not super annoying. That aspect of the show is there because it's part of the the main character's persona. Its just over the top. 
The synopsis - A 50's looking womanizing greaser, in space, accompanied by a robot that cannot be upgraded and a Beatleguiseian Cat. Together they end up in adventures and predicaments and one of theonly threads from show to show is that they hunt rare aliens to categorize for $, and even that is really only a driver to move the characters from place to place. When Shinichirō Watanabe does something its definitely different from anyone else's take on the subject. 


One of the best parts of the show is that the background characters are fleshed out more than you usually see. The main Characters are memorable and have a nice dynamic. The secondary characters always seem like they have their own back story and not thrown in just to be there. Surprisingly there are some episodes that delve into some pretty deep emotional matters (while keeping the funny and ridiculous vibe) and really feel like a full story arc in themselves. Other anime that I've seen take the entire series to convey what can come across in a single episode.


The episodes each say "To Be Continued", but there is not really any continuity that I have seen so far. This does not matter in the least. Some episodes leave the characters in impossible situations with no way to escape or continue the story. You could pick up any episode and get to know the characters enough to enjoy the story without missing anything. Every episode just takes every situation to the very limits of craziness. 


** updated **


Finished with this series and the ending is perfectly fitting. All my previous review stands and I could even add that it gets better and better the further you get into it. That was my experience. 


So yes, just turn off your brain and... Dandy

Space Dandy is something else. It makes sense without making sense.
Story - 9/10
The approach on story telling is properly one of the most remarkable features of the show.
There is no set time in which the episodes take place. Sometimes you have a few episodes actually taking place after another but sometimes they are timeless and there is no real telling when these events take place. The 'when' does not matter for the plot though.
Most episodes are stand-alones though and have a simple main plot.
But as I was writing to begin with 'It makes sense without making sense.' the story might be utterly ridiculous. You willenjoy it on one level or the other though and if you stop expecting super serious and deep subjects, you will start to see the stories have a good depth to them.\n
Some episodes have serious themes but the show finds funny ways to deal with them and might just make you think.\n
Even if the main plot will be easy to spot for each episode, the show will find a way to twist things up and keep you at the edge of your seat.\n
Topnotch technology and established methods as common hunting practices and a pretty realistic feel for the true size of space make it a Sci-Fi anime without slapping it into your face all the time. The comedy elements range from enjoyable to simply ridiculous and obviously over-the-top so they are always present but not overtaking.\n
The ending is no huge finale but suits the show well. It did leave me wanting more and luckily you can go straight ahead with season 2.\n\n
Art - 10/10\n
Seen from an artistic angle you will find dominating Anime elements with some established Western cartoon practices.\n
From time to time you will be wowed with a bit more experimental style that is well fitted into the story.\n
Just watching the main cast walk already has a funny feeling. Movements are displayed mostly realistic and smooth.\n
The character designs are well thought through with waitresses wearing flat shoes instead of high-heels and front-desk workers wearing a plain and non-appealing uniform. Each design could convincingly tell something about the character wearing it.\n
The design of the main crew stands out enough to make them recognizable but not too much to make the crowd around them disappear.\n\n
Sound - 10/10 (addressing the official English dub)\n
For a while I thought this was indeed a Western cartoon made to look and feel like an Anime.\n
The voice actors were chosen well for their characters and did a great job truly acting and not just reading translations off a screen.\n
The music is one of my personal highlights. I have looked up the OST several times and actually decided on one song to keep on my trip playlist.\n
Every tune adds a little magic to the story and it never felt out off place or like it was interrupting an ongoing scene.\n\n
Characters - 10/10\n
The many characteristics of the main crew are displayed on a regular basis and we get to see believable characters with dreams and fears, strengths and faults.\n
In this show every character the main cast is involved with for more than a few minutes gets the chance to show off a more complex personality.\n
I did manage to understand and relate to a lot of the characters in this show even the villains. In a few episodes we learn about a lot about the main villain as well.\n
The main crew does get the chance to show a bit more of their backgrounds as the rest though.\n
It is a shame we do not learn the name of the narrator though he does get his own episode (!) and we have a lot of fun with him before and long after that as well. I have never seen a show that interacts with the narrator this smoothly even adding towards the story.\n\n\n
I think this show might be a good start for non-anime fans but it does add to your enjoyment if you have watched an anime before.\n
The re-watch value of this show is very high. I finished it for the first time other half a year ago and do go back to watching just one episode or even the whole thing from time to time. True, some episodes you will remember every joke and twist after a couple of re-watches but it will never fully lose its magic.

This is an unusual anime.
It does not take itself seriously and bears similarities to... galaxy angel and many other works.
In essence it is based on a loos idea of space adventures - the old kind of space adventures where universe can be magical and anything possible. The protagonist - "space dandy" is looking for previously unknown aliens for profit. And in that setting all kind of things happen. Sometimes the anime is comedic. Sometimes it gets sad. And very often it si surreal and even psychodelic. 
It doesn't take your breath away, but it is definitely enjoyable, and unusual enough to watch it. 
Detailed breakdownbelow:


Story: 6/10

The story is episodic in nature, and has similarity to galaxy angels. Meaning that episodes are separate from each other, and on occasion next episode completely dismisses previous one. Basically, it is not as extreme as galaxy angel's "story reset" at each next episode but it is quite close to it.


The anime is quite ironic, on occasion self-references, and break 4th wall in couple of places. The overall feeling is that somebody just took the idea and tried to have fun with it, in somewhat silly and humorous manner.


The theme of an episode can be anything. From serious, to silly, and to surreal. Some of the alien landscapes and locatiosn were quite amazing. And were indeed, very alien.


If that makes sense.


Art: 8/10:

It didn't make me go wow, but it is very solid and high budget. This animation is extremely fluid along with visual style. Here it is hard to find even a single frame where somebody stays tsill and only opens/closes mouths - as it happens in many cheaper animes. Characters, even minor ones have life in them. I would say that it even bears resemblance to miyazaki's movies in terms of animation quality and attention to characters. 


The anime does use CG in couple of occasions, but it is very well done and nearly impossible to spot.


Very solid art work, and very good animation.


Sound: 7/10:

It is good. it is not breathtaking, but it fits atmosphere of anime well, and doesn't get in your way. It is also unique enough. Basically, you won't find anything similar to "hall of mountain king" or "night at the bald mountain", but it blends very well with the atmosphere and story of the anim, and it works.


Characters: 6/10:

They're walking jokes/caricatures, pretty much. however, within bounds of a single epsidoe they can be complex and lifelike. Despite constant jokes, watching interactions between them is enjoyable.


Enjoyment: 7/10:

I liked it, but wouldn't say I was utterly amazed. Maybe I saw a too much stuff. 


Overall: 7/10:

It is a very good anime with high production values. I wouldn't put it at the same level as some of the masterpieces worth watching, but it is definitely worth a watch, mostly due to amazing animations, psychodelic sequences, and humorous story. 


Overall the anime looks like as if it was something from 1990s that was done today instead - with better technologies and animation qualities. There's minor amoutn of what some people could consider fanservice (mostly cute girls and certain cafe), but it doesn't really go overboard with it.


It is worth a watch. Definitely.

Space Dandy is a dandy, in space. Beyond that, it's a chance for Watanabe and his crew to tell inventive science fiction tales with a strong cast. The animation is wonderful and varies depending on the episode director's personal style. Colorful and unique in so many ways, including some great, far out alien designs. The only two episodes that didn't completely wow me was the first episode, which is unfortunate, and the race episode, which recalls Redline too much without being as interesting. Neither episode is bad, however, so at its worst, it's still an enjoyable show.

Cowboy Bebop: Redonk Version
^ This is how I describe and recommend this anime to my circle of friends, all who hold Cowboy Bebop in high regard, myself included.
The laughs and giggles I get are comparable to the laughs and giggles I've had watching Adventure Time or Futurama, just plain old ridiculousness on a psychedelic background. Perhaps, it's a mix of the aforementioned three: a little space humor; healthy nerdiness; a lot of adult humor; humor that only cartoons can get away with; and finally, a dude who is a dude, a dandy dude in space.
What it excels in, beyond the aforementioned three, is a markedstylization at every scientific loophole and time-space jump. The ramen episode, the ramen episode, the end. I'm really surprised at how varied the animation is, and appreciate the well-fit sound and soundtrack.\n\n
Like Cowboy Bebop, some of the steps it takes are definitively for fans of western cartoons, hence the latter two of the aforementioned three.\n\n
Final words: the end song is extremely addictive and geekily glorious.\n\n
Bottom line: If you enjoy Cowboy Bebop, Adventure Time, and Futurama, this is the anime for you!

Initially, Space Dandy bashes you over the head with sexually suggestive themes. A few episodes later, when it becomes more apparent that it's just an occassional gimmick intended to keep audiences awake, there's actually a wealth of fun to be had watching this series.
I binged the entire series over the past few days and have had an issue with two episodes in particular. First, the "A Race in Space Is Dangerous, Baby" was poorly written. It doesn't have any of that extra dimension that comes with all other episodes, and comes off as a homage to an already terrible cartoon, The Wacky Races. The otherepisode is the one where Dandy forms the Dropkix. The reason I didn't like that episode was because the entire thing was unapologetically out of character for Dandy. It was a good episode of something, but it differentiated itself in character from the rest of the series somehow - the whole band felt shoehorned in, like a TV executive mandated that one episode should be about dandy starting a band.


Anyway, even though all the episodes seem weird and the universe seems to reset with every episode, they actually tied it up quite neatly at the end. The ending of this series is particularly awesome and well worth watching through the entire series to get to.


I'll revisit this series down the road.

Kazuhira's Basic As Fuq Anime Review: Space Dandy Season 1
Story 6:
The story of Space Dandy and his space crew, in space, is largely an episodic comedy. Very little information carries over to subsequent episodes. While several episodes exist in their own universe entirely. First half was relatively hit or miss, while the second half was rather enjoyably. A few episodes were quite praiseworthy, such as one of the more serious stories where Dandy encounters a rare species of alien, a little girl, whom he has to escort to collect the bounty on but bonds with.
Art 9:
My gods the spectacle that is Space Dandy is abeautiful viewing experience. Even during the episodes I wasn't very fond of, the art itself made it worth watching. Use of contrasting colors, explosive particle effects and interesting character designs were glorious.\n\n
Sound 8:\n
The OST of this anime largely consisted of jazzy grooves that just made you feel cool listening too. Very befitting of our MC Mr. Dandy. Worthy of special praise is the true OP which is fantastic. Let it be known that there were no tracks that I disliked or felt didn't belong in the scenes that they came from.\n\n
Character 5:\n
While Dandy and his crew were certainly fun to watch, there was little in the way of character development. As I stated prior, the series is largely episodic. Most of the time you could just assume that each new episode was a Dandy from a different universe. Regardless, there were enough new characters to keep interactions fresh and interesting.\n\n
Final Score: 7\n
Space Dandy is a spectacle to watch. You can enjoy an episode at any time, and friends can jump into the show at pretty much any point, making it very accessible. While it may not be a masterpiece, Studio Bones has certainly put out a very good show. Looking forward to watching the second season.

Space Dandy is a more recent anime that I picked up. I had seen screenshots of Dandy from various episodes, but never knew what the anime was until recently. When I started watching the show. I had found clips of the English dub. I surprisingly liked it?!
Coming from a person who hates English dubs with a burning passion, it's surprising that I ever watched a dubbed version of a show before the subbed. The dub for this show is surprisingly enjoyable & I plan to watch the subbed after to compare the two.
Overall, I enjoy the humor and the art work. The animation for theaction shots is pretty good. Especially episode one when Dandy first meets Meow. The backgrounds are also really good! However, I find the clips with the Gogol empire to be kind of boring and tedious after awhile. It was funny in the beginning, but then everything was simply expected. I didn't really care for that side of the plot. Space Dandy isn't one of my favorite animes, but I still enjoy it very much... I enjoy it so much that I'm currently saving up for a Dandy figurine... And maybe the Honey one too... If my wallet permits it.

This anime was an eye opener for me. I typically watch rom coms, and this is my first review every, so don't judge. The story was laid back, fun, and absolutely pointless. The art was colorful to the point were you barf rainbows for a day. The songs, dear lord the songs in the anime where phenominal. Every song was spot on. I typically skip the part with singing related scenes, but Space Dandy was the first one to ever just hook me onto the songs. The songs were fantastic even though no one talks about them. All the characters you meet are loveable douchebags. I enjoyed this anime not to the fullest becuase of how everythin almost seems to reset every episode, but it was still great none the less. I would recommend this anime to the people who are not into action, even though this anime is categorized as sci-fi. I took the time out of my anime binge watch just to write how much I adore this anime, especially that adorable blonde kid. This anime should have been categorized as slice of life, since it teaches about morals, even though they end up making fun of it 2 seconds later by showing how it never happens. Not my favorite anime of all time, but jesus-kun has blessed me with the music this anime has.

Space Dandy consists of 26 episodes though, leaves you wanting more, not because the ending is unsatisfying, but because it is so good. At first glance this anime may seem odd and nonsensical (which it is) but it is more than that. It is almost impossible to describe and must be seen to really understand and appreciate.
The art style is colorful and flowing. It's energetic and not like any other style I have ever seen in anime.
Lots of upbeat jazz keeps the mood light and energetic. there is a variety of other music as well.
The three main characters Dandy, QT and Meow are lovable, dumband enjoyable to watch run around being ridiculous. There is a multitude of other characters who are equally as lovable. The amount of characters and the amount of soul in each makes it impossible to chose a favorite.\n\n
Space Dandy is an absolute joy to watch and is one of my personal favorites.

Space Dandy. He's a Dandy guy in space. Join Dandy, an idiotic bounty hunter in space, and his companions QT and meow on a journey in space. Also meet more characters that are mostly forgotten about in the next episode. There's an antagonist. Okay, on with the review. Space Dandy is an odd series. Its as I said, about an idiotic bounty hunter in space. He really isn't that great of a bounty hunter or a booth hunter. This series is humorous in the way of how stupid and raunchy it can be. It's silly, dirty(ish) and it's great. The art is colourful and vibrant.The characters are quite good. The soundtrack is good. It's really enjoyable. But I have left the best thing for last. If you have watched the series you may have noticed that it has many similarities to another great series called Cowboy Bebop. This series doesn't just take inspiration from Cowboy Bebop, as many of the people who worked on Space Dandy were veterans who had worked on Cowboy Bebop. \n
Despite all the good things, there are two small problems I had with the series. It had no proper story to it, being an episodic series and the animation is a bit mixed at times with the quality sometimes getting worse but if you can look past those problems I recommend you to watch the series.

Space Dandy is, at the time of writing (March 8th 2016), my favorite anime. I think a lot of that is due to it being made for English audiences first, but I try to overlook that stuff. So what is Space Dandy? Many have made comparisons to Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy, but I feel a more Futurama vibe from it. But enough babbling. On to the review.
Story 8/10: [WARNING] - I may have spoiled something clever in this section. While the series is episodic and I can't spoil plot points, I'm throwing this up here just in case.
This show is episodic, but that doesn'tmean I can't rate the story. I just have to rate the individual stories. This series plays heavily with the multiverse, which you'll easily pick up on not only with the plot of most episodes but also in the lack of continuity. While some of the episode's plots have been done many times before (e.x., a Groundhog Day episode), the show has so much charm that they hold up on their own. While its hard to compare to Cowboy Bebop due to the massive difference in tone, it almost feels like a modern retelling of the classic. 


Art 9/10: Space Dandy is beautiful beyond belief. Bones of course has not failed to disappoint, but I feel a bit sorry for myself making this the second anime I've seen simply because it gave me such high expectations in the animation department. The outdoor backgrounds are painted with psychadelic landscapes while the indoor scenes are populated with dozens of wholly original alien creatures. Animation is always fluid and on the odd occasion where it seems more jittery it still fits with the situation. One of my favorite things about the show's look is how Dandy and Meow are animated in their movements. Both feel very alive at all times. I do have one complaint though, and that is that its painfully obvious where they cut corners in some places to save money for the rest.


Sound 10/10: Oh my God, the voice acting! The music is good too and always fits the situation but there's not much to say beyond that. The voice actors though, let me tell you, are phenomenal. I don't know what I can say about it to elaborate, but if you were to give it a listen you'd know immediately.


Character 8/10: Because its an episodic series its a bit more difficult to judge the characters. Dandy is the lovable buffoon who's a bit of an A-hole but not to a disgusting degree. Meow is the cute yet lazy and agressive sidekick, which makes sense considering his feline-esque species. Finally, QT is the classic straight man keeping them away from each other's throats and on task. There's also Doctor Gel and his assistant/henchman/secret lover whom I've forgotten the name of (looks like a bean) but they don't do much. These characters, despite how they may appear, do absolutely nothing in the story and act solely for comedy. Because of their ominous nature in the beginning of the series I know some people are upset by the fact that they aren't important so I felt I should get that out of the way before anyone else was disappointed.


Enjoyment 10/10: Nothing really to talk about here. Its good not-so-clean fun with goofy antics and subverted tropes around every corner.


Overall 9/10: I really wanted to give Space Dandy a solid 10/10, but taking the average of all my scores for its parts came out to an even 9. This anime is clever, silly, brilliant, and a bit dumb all at the same time, and I applaud it for that. However, I had some problems with the second half. It didn't seem quite as creative, but you can hear my thoughts on that when and if I decide to review season two.

A fashionable Space-Chad, his auto-tune vacuum cleaner and his alien cat friend scour the galaxy in search of new life, in what could have very easily been based on a 2000-AD comic for all of its mix of clever sci-fi concepts mixed with well thought-out humour, that isn't afraid of also delving into the sophomoric (BooBies, anybody?)
Space Dandy is a show that says "Hey, you linear continuity? F**k you, were gonna throw that out the window" before we have even ended the first episode. I have to admire a show that has the balls to do that. 
There are two things I love most aboutthis show; the first is the characters - both the regular cast and the one-time episodic characters manage to be distinct, memorable, and often hilarious. The tropes of 70's/B-movie sci-fi are fired up to the max, exaggerated to levels on par with Futurama's Zapp Brannigan. The second thing that I really love is the art style, maintaining a 70s Disco meets Cowboy Bebop vibe that serves as the shows standard, but then adjusts, usually slowly, to meet the tone of the episode (the most explicit and probably my favourite being the "Plants Are Living Things, Too, Baby" episode. 


The series serves as a sort-of inverse to Cowboy Bebop in Watanabe's projects; S.D. ups the humour and lowers the feels that we see in C.B., yet both shows are able to balance these respective elements very well, which is particularly impressive to me with Space Dandy, as comedy is hard to do, particularly when translating to an audience with a completely different cultural perspective. Particularly impressive is when you manage to mix this in with crazy sci-fi concepts that are happy to build up to stupid end-of-episode punchlines (wait, am I sure this wasn't based on a 2000AD comic?)


As with every show, Space Dandy has its flaws, but sadly its biggest is tied in so closely to the core of the show that it becomes hard to ignore. As much as I can admire the inability of Space Dandy to not give a f**k in respect to continuity/4th wall breaking, it also serves as the shows biggest weakness. In a show where it is established that "anything can happen", including characters being killed off/stranded/left behind/sucked into black holes/etc and returning to normal the next week, it means that nothing in the show matters. All tension, and even arguably any character development the characters go through, is essentially killed off. I have no problems with anime being purely episodic in nature, but its hard to deny its a bit jarring, even if it is intentionally so for comedic effect. If there wasn't so much to fall back on (with particular weight put on the comedy and art-style here), I would call this particular issue critical. As I say, there is a lot else to fall back on, but I would like to have felt a little more excited in the scenes that are supposed to and established to be... well, exciting.


Overall, there is a lot to love about Space Dandy. If you are happy with shows that don't take themselves too seriously while still delivering impressive comedy, colourful characters and some truly great episodes and stylistic animation choices, then I'd say you should stick this show on, sit back, and go with the flow, baby.

Space Dandy is a Dandy guy in space
Created by the same Director of Cowboy Bebop and Samurai Champloo comes a anime about Dandy and his crew and their hunt for rare aliens. If you expect to get the same story/character quality as Watanabe earlier works then you might as well skip this one. Space Dandy is a episodic series with no real connection to each episode. In one episode the crew turns into a zombie and in the next one they go for a hunt on a giant breast monster.. yes you heard me right. Then in the next episode after that they are backat their spaceship alive and ready for more stupid hunts. 




Plot & Story - 6

Each episode does something different. Some episodes are great while others are decent, but for the most part it's pretty enjoyable. There is nothing special going on other than a new setting in which Dandy and his crew are stuck in, hunting aliens or doing something weird like a space race or being on a planet with talking flowers while being chased by a gorilla general for no reason. So If you are looking for a anime with a story and buildup then you will be disappointed. It reminds me of adult cartoons like Family Guy and Simpsons, with action and humor but there does not seem to be a point A to B plot goal for the show to reach. 



Characters - 6

Dandy is Elvis inspired dude, who really loves hit up on all female characters in the show, even if they are aliens. QT is a cleaning robot who is probably the smartest out of the crew.. but then again none of them are really smart to begin with. Tho to be fair as a robot he has a pretty decent character around him, and gets his own episode at the end that shows a more emotional side of him. And at last there is Meow, a weird cat alien like creature who wears shabby clothes and spends a lot of his time on his phone being lazy. From time to time he argues and fight with Dandy which is pretty fun to watch. What I miss is more character development, its pretty lacking even if you take the episodic nature into factor. 



Sound & Music - 7

Watched the first episode in sub and there rest in dub. Both are pretty good. QT has a auto-tune voice in the dub which fits him well. The intro is good, with a funky song that I still have on my brain... don't know if it ever will leave my brain. The soundtrack is for the most part good, nothing rememberable but nowhere bad either. 


Art & Animation - 9

The strong point of this series by far. Wonderful animation, particularly in the first episode. So many colors and fluid animation in motion. The animation quality drops a tad bit after that but stand very strong 


Enjoyment - 7

So far I have been very critical of Dandy expect for the animation. But despite the character and plot flaws I enjoyed Space Dandy for what it is. I did not expect another Cowboy Bebop, but I still think its important to point out what they could have done better and what someone should expect jumping in to it. I will not go out of my way to recommend it, but I recommend to everyone who I into episodic shows with action and humor. 


7/10

Space Dandy is a 26 (splitted in 2 parts)episodes anime series,directed by Shinichiro Watanabe(The guy behind Cowboy Bebop and Samurai Champloo)
In my opinion this is his best work yet .
Where to start...the story is mostly episodic.We follow the adventures of Dandy and his friends in search of rare aliens.And thats it,well..kinda.There is a bit of plot going in the last few episodes of season 2.
The episodic nature of the show and the setting are the strongest parts of the show in fact.The whole show is SUPER versatile and any kind of story works PERFECTLY well.There are different kinds of episodes-with drama,comedy,romance,action,mystery,you name it.The whole teamwas incredibly creative with every single episode.We explore different planets,characters,aliens,universes.Our characters die in few episodes and in the next they are alive.A lot of people hated that and thought that it would never be explained.Weil they explain it in the midlle of the second season and it's very interesting.\n
A lot of people dislike the show,because of the characters and the humour.Well in my opinion the cast is great.They are not your typical anime cliche and have positive and negative traits.Every character from the main cast gets their screen time and moments of glory.The end of season 2 focuses on character development and a bit of drama.\n
My favourite episode from season 1 was ep 5 and from season 2- ep 10.About the humour-it's not your typical anime comedy,which can be hit or miss.It depends on your taste.\n
The animation-in my opinion this is the best looking anime tv series.The design of the planets and the aliens is amazing.The character design is stylish.The animation style changes between some episodes to reflect the tone.The opening is super catchy and presents the show amazing.\n
I would give it an easy 10/10 it's not perfect obviously,but this is probably the most creative show out there.

Alright. I'm becoming more familiar with anime and have been seeing too many negative reviews for this show, so I must write my opinions down for Space Dandy whether I am a credible source or not.
First of all, the plot: Space Dandy's crew tries to hunt rare aliens to make money and spend it how they please.
The gorilla (Dr. Gel) is chasing Dandy, because he is believed to possess a rare element known as pionium. Pionium is believed by Gel's employer- a SPACE EMPEROR WITH A FLAMING SKULL HEAD- to be the secret to defeating rival nations. How will it defeat these rival nations? Youdo not know unless you watch more of the series to discover its effects through Dandy.


[This gives one the drive to view the series besides the creative mind-bending episodes that makes one think twice about how the universe works. Seriously. I have tried to view each new episode as critically as possible, but nearly each installment provided new and intelligent themes to enjoy and ponder.]


Art: Space Dandy is one of the best series that I have viewed as far as animation goes. The movements are extremely fluid and no two characters are completely alike.


Sound: Fabulous. I take sound pretty seriously, and there are several episodes where my jaw tends to drop. In Season 2 episode 5, I love the scene where Dandy is dragged through multiple waves of water. How you imagine it would sound like if it were to happen to you in real life is exactly how it is replicated in the show. Voice actors are top notch as well.


Characters: Meh. Who cares. This show is all about doing whatever the heck you feel like, baby. You get 1 lazy luster, 1 techy moocher, and 1 hopeless goody-goody who are set amongst this amazing world, and you achieve a flat-out stellar experience. Feel good. Feel unashamed. Do your best. Do your worst. If all else fails, pull a cosmic string and move on to meet more species in the amazing universe both friendly...and not...


Grasping the tone of this anime- the lightheartedness and intrigue of discovery- is probably the most difficult "task." However, I believe Space Dandy to be one of the easier animes to understand, because the show makes a firm point that not everything can be understood. Dandy does not care and neither should you. This is perhaps the only reason that I rate this show a 9 instead of a 10, because it's human instinct to make logical sense of the world. Therefore, it may not have universal appeal.


Try it and enjoy.

This series is AMAZING. I HIGHLY recommend anyone looking for something like Cowboy Bebop watch this. Heck. If you just want a fun journey, than watch this. SPACE DANDY IS AMAZING!!!!!!! If there's one criticism I have with the series is that there wasn't an OVA. Everything from the Story to even the Visuals was amazing. It's so good that I'm rewatching it at this very moment as I type these very words. But enough good. Let's get into the nitty gritty.........the BAD. Here's the thing. As fun as Space Dandy is.........it can kind of get old after a while. Sure it's fun seeing Dandytry to pick up chicks and catch aliens but......That's all Space Dandy is. A guy and his crew catching aliens and hanging out at Boobies to try and get chicks. Now that's not to say the series is in anyways bad. It's really good, and when it has it's emotional moments, it works. Those moments can get you really emotional. Overall I'd give Space Dandy a 8. It's in no way a masterpiece but it's also not the worst piece of trash in any pile. It's overall a good series. I'd recommend anyone watch it if they want Cowboy Bebop's spiritual successor.

I'm not really leaving a review, I'm just going to explain why the other reviews here have pissed me off.
The gripe they have with Space Dandy is that it is not what they were expecting.  That's it.  If you read through the reviews, it quickly beocmes apparent most of them went in expecting Cowboy Bebop or a space adventure series with a 12 episode plot.  Space Dandy is none of that.
Like K-on is cute girls doing cute girls, Space Dandy is about a cool guy doing cool things.  It is episodic and each episode is a ride in and of itself.That is what this anime is.  You can't criticize it for not having an overarching plot in each episode because that's not what Space Dandy is.\n\n
The animation is a solid 10/10, the characters are rather static but they are great and fun to watch, and the story of each episode varies in genre and complexity but is almost always interesting.  Space Dandy has 20 minute romances that outclass what other anime do in 24 episodes.  It depicts the rise and fall of a galaxy-famous rockstar, a touching parental relationship between two unrelated people, and so much more.  Its experimental animation and story-telling techniques could have flopped, but they didn't.  \n\n
This is an anime you should watch and enjoy for what it is instead of complaining about what it isn't.  Just skip season 2 episode 4, which is actually trash.

Note: This review covers my general thoughts for both seasons of Space Dandy.
This has got to be one of the most underrated anime I have ever seen. It is consistently funny, gorgeously animated, has a surprising amount of emotion, and full of memorable moments and characters. There is such a huge variety  of episodes in terms of tone and genres that I guarantee that there is at least one episode that you will like.
The cons:
There really is just one con I could find. Space Dandy is very episodic. If you are looking for an anime with an amazing, multilayered, deep, and unpredictable plot. Youwon't find it here. The over arching story is as bare bones as it gets in Space Dandy. Though I personally feel its episodic nature is the show's greatest strength some might view it as being to simple or random and unfocused.


All of the characters except Dandy. Though I personally liked all of the other characters in the show besides Dandy himself, some could see them as uninteresting or underdeveloped. The Show is really all about Dandy, but I will say that every other character gets at least one episode that focuses entirely on them and gives them a chance for development.


The pros:

The animation. if you are familiar with Studio BONES this is hands down some of their best work. The animation is stunning there is always something beautiful to look at on screen. If you are not familiar with studio BONES some of their works include: My Hero Academia, Soul Eater, One Punch Man (many free lance animators that often work with BONES worked with studio Madhouse on One PUnch Man), Cowboy Bebop, Fullmetal Alchemist, Sword of the Stranger, and Fullmetal Alchemist Brotherhood.  


The sheer variety of stories and genres this show tackles means that the show can please anyone. There is a musical episode, an episode that pays homage to all the classic George Romero zombie films, there are whacky space adventures and races, there are episodes that act as great love stories, there are episodes that are full of emotion, there is an episode like a rock and roll band bio-pic film, there are episodes about time travel, other dimensions, an episode like a courtroom drama series, there are episodes that have horror elements, and so much more. It might seem like I am spoiling a lot but trust me when I say these episodes need to be seen to be believed. This huge variety of episodes also lets us see a lot of different aspects of Dandy's (the main character) personality. I feel that you do not always need a over arching story to have complex or interesting characters and feel that Space Dandy is proof of that. He can be dumb, gentle, sleazy, smooth, genuinely kind, confident, vulnerable, bad ass, and so much more.


The show is almost always funny and when it isn't, there is still a surprising amount of emotion. Plus there is always some incredible animation to look at.


Side note, The dub for Space Dandy is awesome.

::THIS INCLUDES MY THOUGHTS FOR THE ENTIRE SERIES, CONSIDER THIS A REVIEW FOR BOTH SEASONS::
Space🌟Dandy is easily the most visually impressive anime of the last couple years, excluding the Monogatari Series. And seeing as Studio Bones is responsibly for this, it's a pretty reasonable assumption to make when you haven't seen it. And if you have, like me, then you'll understand completely. Space🌟Dandy is a show all about free will and free expression, all the way down to its very framework (or should i say... "bones" haha).
When looking at the people who worked on this show, you'll come to notice a broad range of verytalented animators and directors including its main director, Shinichiro Watanabe, who you should know as the director of Cowboy Bebop AND Samurai Champloo. Space🌟Dandy also boasts the involvement of Shingo Natsume (director of One Punch Man), Sayo Yamamoto (Director of Yuri on ICE), and various script writers, including Sato Dai and Ichiro Okouchi (the original creator of Code Geass). 


What this is is a pool of talent from all over anime, coming together to create this strange show known as Space🌟Dandy. When watching the show, you'll notice just how distinct Space🌟Dandy really is. Unbound creativity really all you can expect from any given episode of the show. It really is quite dandy.


The Visuals:

This is where the show is not only the strongest, but also crosses the line into being groundbreaking. There is no shortage of times when I was completrly blown away by some of the animation in the show. A good example would be one of the later spisodes of season 2, where there are 4th dimensional beings and 2nd dimensional beings interacting eith the 3rd dimension (ours), and the way the show is able to visalize this already awesome idea is very interesting to look at. 


Space🌟Dandy utilizes many different, yet similar methods of animation and color design. the show makes full use of the entire visible color spectrum across both seasons. Many times, the outlines of the characters will be blue, or red. And that always makes for a cool effect. The character designs are all very distinct from each other and have enough detail in the, to tell you something substantial about the characters, but also simple enough to where it can be animated easily and doesn't ever look awkward.


The talent that was put into this series is never wasted, and it feels asmif the show is constantly in a state of evolution. Nothing ever gets stale, and there is no real hardline status quo in terms of visuals. But it still has cohesion, and each episode is identifiably Space🌟Dandy without a doubt.


The Sound Design:

Space🌟Dandy proudly exhibits great voice acting both in the english and japanese versions. I personally watched the dub, and I can vouch for its quality. Ian Sinclair plays Dandy, and he does an amazing job! I have liked a few Sinclair roles in the past, but this is easily his best. The dub has many other good voice actors and actresses including Alexis Tipton, who does a surprisingly good job. There is also noteworthy a minor role in season 2 played by Johnny Young Bosch that was infinitely more amusing when i realized he was playing a character with the same first name.


The series has a really kickass opening theme with a catchy beat and lyrics that are fun to sing along to. The OP feels like an explosion of color, which feels very appropriate for the series, even when an episode might be in monochrome.


The Story & Characters:

When it comes to characters, there are mainly three core cast members. Dandy, Meow, and QT. There are other recurring characters like Dr. Gel and Honey. But none pf the episodes are ever really about them. Each character has a distinct personality thatmaffords for all kinds of interesting and fun interactions between them.


Alright so first off is Dandy. He's a dandy guy in space. He's characterized as a normal dude, and really all he lives for is to just go to Boobie, his favorite restaurant. While what he literally is described as is quite simple, what he represents  is far more fundamental to the anrrstive of the series. Dandy represents free will. And the show is a celebration of free will and free expression. And the finale of season 2 is the best literal example to give (but i won't spoil it for you, you'll just have to see for yourself!)


Then there is Meow. I love Meow. A catperson after my own heart. Not only do i love cats, but I also love Meow's personality. He just kinda slacks off and chills and does his own thing. And what he does mostly consists of stuff I would do. I love his easygoing attitude and how he is always looking for the most convenient way to accomplish the various missions he, QT, and Dandy go on. There is a really good episode in season 1 that characterizes him more, but i'll let you experience it for yourself!

Some of the best jokes involve him too.


Lastly there is QT, an intelligent vacuum cleaner robot thing. He is basically the straight man of the trio. While i dont like him as much as Dandy or Meow, QT is still a really fun character. He is often the voice of reason, and the one who is constantly dragging Dandy and Meow down the muddy dirt road of responsibility. He has a pretty interesting personality considering the nature of his being, and he has some pretty witty lines and some good jokes.


Now let's talk about the most interesting element, The story.


Space🌟Dandy is about a Dandy guy in Space. And that's really the most consistent thing across every episode. Yeah sure Dandy and his crew are alien hunters and they often are hunting rare aliens, but not every episode is about that. Some episodes start off with that being the main motivation, but it quickly evolves into something else. While some episodes are better than others, they all have some interesting element to them that is unique to THAT episode. One particularly strange episode is set on a plaent compeltely populated by plants that are not technically alive, but clearly are when you talk to them. It's stuff like this that made me go "whoa, wtf is this?" very often.


The setting is a very unique blend of Science Fiction, Contemporary Fiction, and Fantasy. So there really is no restriction in what the series can portray in any given episode. One episode will take place in a high school and be a musical, but then another episode will be about a zombie apocalypse, or it'll take place on a world where the life is so alien to what we understand as living that it's hard to describe as alive, yet it is.


That is another one of Space🌟Dandy's best elements. The fact that any episode could be about anything makes the show unpredictable. Some episodes are just goofy comedy, others are touching and sentimental, and others explore some really out there sci fi concept. 


Space🌟Dandy is like a box of chocolates, you never really know what you're gonna get. And the chocolate is always tasty no matter what.


I give this entire series a 9/10. I would recommend this to anyone looking for some cool, inventive, often trippy animation. Or if you like episodic adventure shows, or just shows that are strange. Really anyone could watch Space🌟Dandy and appreciate it. Either way, WATCH IT. WATCH IT NOW.

This show got a ton of slack from the cowboy bebop fanboys. But in all honesty, If you're wondering if you should watch the show or not i highly recommend it. The story follows dandy, who is a bounty hunter tasked with finding new species of aliens for cash.  Along for the ride with him is two other protagonists, Meow and qt, a robot and taking cat. This show will mainly keep you focused on its art style, humor, and how each episodes story progresses. Yes this anime is an episode by episode anime, But it all ties together towards the end. Dandy isan amazing character who isn't one dimensional by any means. In each episode we see that not only does he have a lust for the female figure, But that he's also a caring individual who relies on the characters who travel with him. To rap this up. Speaking from a non biased opinion. Give the show a try. If the first 5 episodes don't do it for you, then drop it. If you liked cowboy bebop. Chances are you will like this show as they are practically in the same universe.
